articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: There were no immediate reports of casualties. Israeli authorities said air sirens were activated in areas southeast of Tel Aviv.
articles.title: Hezbollah says launches volley of rockets into Israel, Blinken returns seeking ceasefire

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Australia, the United States and 13 other countries criticized China at the United Nations on Tuesday over alleged human rights abuses in Xinjiang and Tibet, prompting China to denounce them for ignoring the "living hell" in the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: West blasts China on rights, China responds: What about Gaza?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told Russia's Vladimir Putin that the international situation was gripped by chaos but that Beijing's strategic partnership with Moscow was a force for stability amid the most significant changes seen in a century.
articles.title: Xi tells Putin the world is in chaos but friendship with Russia will endure

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday upheld the use of a criminal trespassing charge against nearly all of the 1,500 defendants accused of taking part in the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, rejecting an attempt to further restrict the charges available to prosecutors.
articles.title: Capitol riot defendants face upheld trespassing charges in US court

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Tuesday that G7 and European Union allies are "very close" to finalizing a $50 billion loan to Ukraine backed by frozen Russian assets, with an expected U.S. contribution of about $20 billion.
articles.title: US, G7 allies 'very close' to finalizing $50 billion Ukraine loan, Yellen says

articles.author: Kaori Kaneko, Tim Kelly, Irene Wang
articles.description: Karen Makishima is the only female running for Japan's ruling party in her 20-seat prefecture for the Oct. 27 general election, reflecting the tough battle women face in breaking into the country's male dominated politics.
articles.title: A man's world: Japan makes tepid push on gender gap in politics as election nears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A shootout just outside the capital of Mexico's Sinaloa state killed 19 suspected gang members on Monday, while one local cartel leader was arrested, Mexico's defense ministry announced in a statement late on Tuesday.
articles.title: Shootout in Mexico's Sinaloa state claims 19 lives, cartel leader arrested

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Global warming made the seasonal downpours this year about 5-20% more intense.
articles.title: Climate change worsened rains in flood-hit African regions, scientists say

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Niue celebrated 50 years of self-government on Saturday, with Britain's King Charles issuing a congratulatory video, but the Pacific Island state is excluded from this week's Commonwealth leaders meeting, and its prime minister wants change.
articles.title: Pacific island Niue wants seat at Commonwealth leaders table

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Democratic U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris held a marginal 46% to 43% lead over Republican former President Donald Trump, with a glum electorate saying the country is on the wrong track, a new Reuters/Ipsos poll found.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris holds 46%-43% lead over Trump amid voter gloom, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds
